author: stefan2
msg: On the fsx-1.10 branch:
Fix the DEBUG run.
* subversion/libsvn_fs_x/transaction.c
(commit_body): We need to flush (not fsync) the APR file buffers before
checking the revision contents through an independent
FS instance.

author: stefan2
msg: On the fsx-1.10 branch:
Piggy-back the txn-id allocation onto the FSX commit, such that the next
txn with the same svn_fs_t instance can be started with no additional fsync.
Operations like 'svnadmin load' will commit a sequence of revisions through
the same svn_fs_t instance.  Per revision, a new transaction is being
created, which involves bumping 'txn-current', in turn requiring 2 fsyncs.
This patch pre-allocates a new txn-ID during commit such that those fsync
calls can be executed as part of the 'current' bump.  Hence, the marginal
costs of adding a revision is then down to the 2 fsync delays needed for
the commit.
Because bumping 'txn-current' requires the aquisition of txn-current-lock,
we need to revise the locking order.  txn-current-lock will now be taken
out inside the commit body, i.e. *after* the write-lock.  The lock order
did not matter in the past as those locks were unrelated.  However, the
"with-all-locks" function used a different ordering that what we need now
and we have to change that ordering consistently.
* subversion/libsvn_fs_x/fs.h
(svn_fs_x__shared_data_t): Revise the lock ordering documentation and
reorder declarations accordingly to minimize
the chance of confusion.
(svn_fs_x__data_t): Add a field for the pre-allocated txn-id.
* subversion/libsvn_fs_x/transaction.c
(lock_id_t,
init_lock_baton): Declarations and switch-cases to reflect the new lock
order.  Not necessary but keeps things less confusing.
(svn_fs_x__with_all_locks): Actually change the lock acquisition order.
(create_txn_dir): Don't bump the 'txn-current' if there is already a
pre-allocated txn-id that we can just use.
(bump_ids_baton_t,
bump_ids): Factored out from commit_body and adding the pre-allocation
of a txn-id.
(commit_body): Execute the id bumps while holding the txn-current-lock.
